intro: Viola cano-barbata var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered violets, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this variant thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and clustered foliage. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the viola genus.
